chess

Class MoveCheck

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.MoveCheck

  • public class MoveCheck
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for checking if move is valid/possible
    Author:
    Tyler Latawiec, Brian Huang

      static boolean isValid(int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY, GameBoard gb)

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public static boolean isValid(int startX,
                              int startY,
                              int endX,
                              int endY,
                              GameBoard gb)
        Method accepts the starting position of a piece and the position it is trying to move to, checks if another side is trying to move the opposing sides' pieces. Afterwards, sends position parameters to isPossible method, which determines if the move can be executed
        Parameters:
        startX - - initial x position of piece to be moved
        startY - - initial y position ...
        endX - - x position after piece is moved
        endY - - y position ...
        gb - - current state of chess board
        Returns:
        true if valid move, false if invalid

      • isPossible

        public static boolean isPossible(int startX,
                                 int startY,
                                 int endX,
                                 int endY,
                                 GameBoard gb)
        Method accepts the starting and ending position of a move and sees if it is possible or not. Considers all special cases such as En Passant, Castling, etc...
        Parameters:
        startX - - initial x position of piece to be moved
        startY - - initial y position ...
        endX - - x position after piece is moved
        endY - - y position ...
        gb - - current state of chess board
        Returns:
        true if possible move, false if impossible
